svcsubproc.title: Dash Board Panels, Cluster and Switch Panels
svcsubproc.para: The dash panel, switch panels and drivers storage panels are all constructed of injection molded composite material. All panels assemble together to make a clean fully functional assembly, enhancing visibility and ease of operation, with the ergonomically designed panels. All panels are removable for access to the components and assemblies in the driver control area ( Figure 206). To remove the dash panels follow the procedures as listed.

figure.caption: Figure 206. Passenger Side Entry- Dash Panel Section

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. PASSENGER SIDE ENTRY DASH COVER PANEL
4. PASSENGER ENTRY PANEL COVER TOP PANEL MOUNTING SCREW

step2.para: Beginning at the passenger entry door and step well, locate the dash panel mounting bolts along the leading edge of the step well panel at the lower section of the windshield glass and seal.
Loosen and remove the panel mounting bolts.
Locate the panel lower edge mounting screws the secure the panel to the entry panel or step well heater panel (if equipped). Loosen and remove the mounting screws.
With the mounting screws and bolts removed, lift the step well panel cover upward and out.

step1.para: Dash Panel / Cluster And Right Switch Panel

step2.para: Locate and remove the forward edge mounting bolts along the lower windshield seal. Loosen and remove the mounting bolts.
Slide the driver side window forward section open to access the mounting screw at the left hand corner of the dash panel assembly. Loosen and remove the mounting screw.
Locate the right wing switch panel, locate and remove any optional equipment mountings that may be mounted to the right wing switch panel; e.g., communication radio microphone ( Figure 207).

figure.caption: Figure 207. Right Wing Switch Panel Remove

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. DRIVER RIGHT WING PANEL BEZEL TRIM RING
2. RIGHT WING PANEL BEZEL AND COVER MOUNTING SCREWS

step2.para: To remove right wing switch panel trim bezel, locate the four mounting screws ( Fig. 207 Item 2) attaching the switch panel and bezel assembly. Loosen and remove.
Remove the switch panel assembly and disconnect harness connections if necessary.
Prior to removing the instrument cluster, the steering column cover must be removed. Locate the upper and lower column cover mounting screws.
Loosen and remove the mounting screws and remove the steering column covers.
Locate the cluster bezel assembly and remove the bezel.
Locate the cluster mounting screws, loosen and remove.
Lift the instrument cluster out to access the harness connections. Disconnect the instrument cluster harness and remove cluster.

step1.para: Left Hand Driver Switch Panel And Storage Bin

step2.para: The left hand switch panel contains the operating controls for many of the bus interior functions ( Figure 62, Item 3). The switch panel assembly must be removed first.
Locate the heater, defroster, and recirculation control switches to the rear of the left hand switch panel. Remove the control knobs for the heater controls.
Locate the six left hand switch panel mounting screws.

figure.caption: Figure 210. Heat Control and Left Switch Panel Assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. DRIVER LEFT WING SWITCH PANEL MOUNTING SCREWS

step2.para: Loosen and remove the panel screws.
Lift the switch panel out and disconnect necessary harnesses for removal of the switch panel.
Open the driver side storage compartment bin cover. Locate the mounting screws in the bottom of the storage bin. Loosen and remove the mounting screws.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. LEFT WING PANEL STORAGE BIN MOUNTING SCREWS (THREE OF SIX SHOWN IN BOTTOM OF STORAGE BIN)

step2.para: Locate the lower edge mounting screws mounting the panel to the driver's heater assembly.
Locate the heater / defroster control harness and disconnect.
Lift and remove the left hand panel dash assembly and storage bin.
Disconnect the 12 volt power receptacle harness from the storage bin receptacle (if applicable).
